intro: Malacocarpus sessiliflorus, commonly known as the sessile-flowered malacocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals and stamens that are usually yellow or white in color. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
